title: Newline
summary: Newline (frequently called line ending, end of line (EOL), next line (NEL) or line break) is a control character or sequence of control characters in a character encoding specification (e.g., ASCII, EBCDIC) that is used to signify the end of a line of text and the start of a new one,[1] e.g., Line Feed (LF) in Unix. Some text editors set this special character when pressing the â†µ Enter key.
